questions.question: What does TSS stand for?
questions.feedback: TSS stands for Total Suspended Solids, which are particles suspended in water that can be trapped by a filter.

questions.question: What does BOD stand for?
questions.feedback: BOD stands for Biochemical Oxygen Demand, which measures the oxygen required by microorganisms to break down organic matter.

questions.question: What does F/M stand for?
questions.feedback: F/M is the Food to Microorganism ratio, which helps determine the loading rate of organic material in activated sludge systems.

questions.question: What does MLSS stand for?
questions.feedback: MLSS stands for Mixed Liquor Suspended Solids, which refers to the concentration of suspended solids in the aeration tank.

questions.question: What does RAS stand for?
questions.feedback: RAS stands for Returned Activated Sludge, which is the settled activated sludge that is returned to the aeration tank.

questions.question: What does WAS stand for?
questions.feedback: WAS stands for Waste Activated Sludge, which is the excess biomass removed from the treatment process.

questions.question: What does SVI stand for?
questions.feedback: SVI stands for Sludge Volume Index, which indicates the settling characteristics of activated sludge.

questions.question: What does VSS stand for?
questions.feedback: VSS stands for Volatile Suspended Solids, which are organic particles in water that can volatilize at high temperatures.

questions.question: What does TKN stand for?
questions.feedback: TKN stands for Total Kjeldahl Nitrogen, which is the total concentration of organic nitrogen and ammonia in a sample.

questions.question: What does DO stand for?
questions.feedback: DO stands for Dissolved Oxygen, which is the amount of oxygen available in water for aquatic organisms and treatment processes.

questions.question: What does COD stand for?
questions.feedback: COD stands for Chemical Oxygen Demand, a measure of the amount of oxygen required to chemically oxidize organic compounds in water.

questions.question: What does SCADA stand for?
questions.feedback: SCADA stands for Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition, a system used for remote monitoring and control in wastewater facilities.

questions.question: What does SRT stand for?
questions.feedback: SRT stands for Solids Retention Time, the average time solids remain in the treatment system.

questions.question: What does NTU stand for?
questions.feedback: NTU stands for Nephelometric Turbidity Units, a measurement of water clarity based on light scattering.

questions.question: What does VSR stand for?
questions.feedback: VSR stands for Volatile Solids Reduction, a measure of organic solids degradation in sludge digestion.

questions.question: What does UV stand for in disinfection?
questions.feedback: UV stands for Ultraviolet, a disinfection method that uses UV light to inactivate microorganisms in wastewater.

questions.question: What does EQ stand for in wastewater treatment?
questions.feedback: EQ stands for Equalization, which refers to balancing flow or loading in a treatment process to improve performance.

questions.question: What does HRT stand for?
questions.feedback: HRT stands for Hydraulic Retention Time, which is the average time that wastewater remains in a treatment tank.

questions.question: What does THM stand for?
questions.feedback: THM stands for Trihalomethanes, a group of chemical byproducts formed during chlorination of drinking water and wastewater.

questions.question: What does RO stand for?
questions.feedback: RO stands for Reverse Osmosis, a water purification process that uses a semi-permeable membrane to remove contaminants.

questions.question: What does CSO stand for?
questions.feedback: CSO stands for Combined Sewer Overflow, which occurs when combined stormwater and sewage systems exceed capacity and discharge untreated water.

questions.question: What does SBR stand for?
questions.feedback: SBR stands for Sequencing Batch Reactor, a type of activated sludge process where treatment occurs in timed cycles in a single tank.

questions.question: What does MBR stand for?
questions.feedback: MBR stands for Membrane Bioreactor, a wastewater treatment process that combines biological treatment with membrane filtration.

questions.question: What does GPD stand for?
questions.feedback: GPD stands for Gallons Per Day, a common unit for measuring flow rates in wastewater systems.

questions.question: What does TDS stand for?
questions.feedback: TDS stands for Total Dissolved Solids, referring to all inorganic and organic substances dissolved in water.

questions.question: What does MCRT stand for?
questions.feedback: MCRT stands for Mean Cell Residence Time, the average time that activated sludge solids stay in the system.

questions.question: What does SOP stand for?
questions.feedback: SOP stands for Standard Operating Procedure, which outlines consistent, safe procedures for operations and maintenance tasks.

questions.question: What does PPE stand for?
questions.feedback: PPE stands for Personal Protective Equipment, used to protect workers from health and safety hazards on the job.

questions.question: What does I&I stand for in wastewater?
questions.feedback: I&I stands for Inflow and Infiltration, which refers to stormwater or groundwater entering a sewer system, increasing flow and treatment demand.

questions.question: What does NPDES stand for?

choices.text: New Pollutant Disposal and Evaluation Standards
National Permit for Discharge of Environmental Substances

questions.feedback: NPDES stands for National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System, a permit program that controls water pollution by regulating point sources.
